text: Imagine I'm snorkeling on a coral reef off Maui, collecting observations for my little underwater photo log.
First, I sit at the water's edge, slip on my mask and snorkel, and snug my fins over bare feet, making sure they're tight but not cutting off circulation.
I take a deep breath through the snorkel, ease off the ledge, and kick gently with long, slow strokes so I don't blast clouds of sand below me.
As I drift over the reef, I'm scanning for schools of parrotfish and the bright yellow tangs darting in and out of the corals.

Anytime I see something interesting, a clownfish peeking out of the anemone, or a trumpetfish hovering upright, I pause, hold my breath, and point my camera straight down to snap a quick shot without kicking up silt.
